Using some procedural tanks I was trying to make something sort of like the Boeing LEO concept, Martin Renova, Douglas SASSTO,  etc (though smaller). Basically, a large, capsule shaped SSTO.

Anyway, the nose needed to be a very large fairing with the payload within. It seems like a fairing that would perhaps open like a flower or clamshell (pictured above), and could then close again would be useful. Does such a mod exist? If not, is it possible?

This would require an animated part of the two fairing halves, like the KW Rocketry Apollo SLA, so that it can open and close. Then, the mod Old School Fairings so that in can shield the contents from the aerodynamic flow.
Seems like the bones are already in stock, the shrouded docking port, for example.
You can lock the shape of procedural fairing pieces and put them on Infernal robotics hinges. However, I don't know it such a contraption would actually shield the payload.
The closest I can think of is the "petal" cargo bay in SpaceY. You'd have to put a nosecone on top though, which would float when the cargo bay is open.
Yeah, I have SpaceY, I was wanting something that opened on top. It doesn't matter aside from aesthetics, really, it can reenter minus the fairing as is.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/126241-ksp-105beta-10-kerbal-tubes/ perhaps something like the docking iris from Sticky32's Kerbal Tubes?

Peace.
